title: Sutton Cheney Wharf Walk Route

images.title: A-M-Jervis / Sutton Cheney Wharf
images.caption: Sutton Cheney Wharf. Narrowboats and a miniature one moored at the wharf on the Ashby Canal. Some of these will take public parties for a trip along the canal. The building contains a shop and cafe. This site is on the edge of the Bosworth Battlefield and a pleasant, if slightly muddy, footpath starts here and passes behind the cafe and through woods to a visitor centre on the battlefield.

images.title: Mat Fascione / Bridge 34: Sutton Wharf Bridge
images.caption: Bridge 34, Sutton Wharf Bridge

images.title: Mat Fascione / Footpath through Ambion Wood
images.caption: Footpath through Ambion Wood. Ambion Wood lies along the Ashby Canal and close to the site of The Battle of Bosworth. The footpath is the Leicestershire Round.

images.title: Mat Fascione / Footpath to Bosworth Field Battlefield Site
images.caption: Footpath to Bosworth Field Battlefield Site

images.title: Mat Fascione / Ashby Canal north of Geary's Bridge
images.caption: Ashby Canal north of Geary's Bridge

images.title: Mat Fascione / Hercules Inn, Sutton Cheney
images.caption: Hercules Inn, on the Main Street in the village.

description: This circular walk from Sutton Cheney Wharf takes you along the Ashby Canal and through the surrounding woodland and countryside. It's a lovely place for a stroll with the easy towpath trails and the site of a historic battlefield to visit nearby. You start off at the car park at Sutton Wharf next to the bridge and the canal. You then follow a section of the Leicestershire Round north west along the canal and through Ambion Wood toward Ambion Hill. Near here you can visit the Bosworth Battlefield site. This field is the site of the last significant battle of the Wars of the Roses, the civil war that took place in the 15th century. The route then bends round to the east to visit Sutton Cheney village. From the village you follow footpaths south to Harper's Hill before heading west to Stapleton Lane. Near here you can then rejoin the canal and follow it north back to the car park.
